sub_title: Mission Critical Engineer at Schuberg Philis
summary:
I have over 16 years of solid technical experience in designing, building, and running applications, both in Austria and in the Netherlands. I thoroughly enjoy the challenge of seeing projects through from start to finish. Furthermore, I'm a highly driven individual who enjoys keeping up-to-date with the latest technical developments and I pride myself on self-development and lifelong learning in the field. At present, I am employed as Mission Critical Engineer at Schuberg Philis in Schiphol Rijk where I am involved in all kinds of development and operations work with a sole focus on AWS for which I also hold multiple certifications. 

* 17 years of professional technical experience in designing, building, and running systems.
* 10 years experience in technical and team leadership
* 8 years of designing and implementing solutions in AWS (Certified Solution Architect and DevOps Professional) 
* Track record of DevSecOps commitment (CI/CD, everything automated, code first, small updates, least privilege, monitoring, alerting, etc.) 
* Implementation and operation of microservices architectures 
* Knowledge of methods and algorithms in the domains of Information Retrieval, Machine Learning, Information Extraction, Natural Language Processing
* Experience in development of scalable solutions using technologies like SolrCloud, ElasticSearch, Cassandra, Openstack Swift, Kafka, Storm
* Major knowledge and experience with information retrieval technologies (Solr and ElasticSearch)
* E-commerce experience using Hybris framework

projects.title: Europeana Newspapers
projects.description:
We’re doing this via two prominent cultural heritage websites: Europeana and The European Library. 

Our project is:
Funded under the European Commission’s CIP 2007 – 2013 programme.
A three-year project, running until January 2015.
Aggregating 18 million historic newspaper pages for Europeana and The European Library.
Converting 10 million newspaper pages to full text. This will help users quickly search for specific articles, people and locations mentioned within the newspaper.
Creating a special content viewer to improve online newspaper browsing at http://www.theeuropeanlibrary.org/tel4/newspapers
Building tools that will allow professionals to better assess the quality of newspaper digitisation in relation to level of detail, speed and costs.

projects.title: LERU Open Access Portal for Law
projects.description: Aggregating open access law content (journal articles, conference proceedings, monographs, book chapters, text books, reports, powerpoint presentations, research theses) from 12 European University Libraries members of LERU (League of European Research Universities) by harvesting data via OAI PMH (DC, MODS) processing and publishing to the law portal.

contributors.headline: Mission Critical Engineer at Schuberg Philis
Head, Research Services (Library) at  Delft University of Technology

projects.title: Europeana Libraries
projects.description:
Europeana Libraries brought the digital collections of 19 of Europe's leading research libraries to Europeana and The European Library.

The content includes:

1,200 film and video clips
850,000 images
4.3 million texts (books, journal articles, theses, letters)
Europeana Libraries created a valuable resource for scholars and built a robust network of national, university and research libraries, supported by Europe's major research library organisations.

HIGHLIGHTS

5 Million Objects: Digitised books, films and images are freely available online. Subjects range from Oriental manuscripts to Spanish civil war photographs and represent a wide geographical spread that covers the length and breadth of Europe.

Full-text Indexing: This is the first cultural digitisation project that incorporates full-text indexing and searching capabilities. This creates the potential for in-depth academic study of all texts brought together by Europeana Libraries.

Representation: Europeana Libraries provided research libraries with a platform to promote their collections to the widest possible audience. It lays the foundation on which a critical mass of research resources can be based.

Aggregation: This project unites content from several libraries and creates a single channel for contributing library content to Europeana and The European Library. The model is efficient, cost-effective and capable of being extended to research libraries across Europe.

High Quality Metadata: The quality and structure of library metadata will be improved. This will make online searching more accurate and user-friendly. New features such as timelines and maps will also be supported.

profile_positions.description:
* Leading design, build and run phase of AWS solutions in various domains with different programming languages for IaC and business logic.
* Thought leader to continuously evolve AWS landing platforms to enable DevOps teams.
* Lead the development of a pass-through proxy for the Gitlab server, enabling Gitlab CI jobs to automatically enrich builds with temporary AWS credentials enforcing Gitflow model for DTAP deployments.
* Rearchitecting and migrating on-premise systems to AWS.
* Served as security lead and gained expertise in depth knowledge of various security aspects.
* Led development efforts to design an orchestration layer for route planning algorithms, develop a suite of microservices for pricing, validation, etc., and create a service that performs validation, normalization, and transformation of data formats based on consumer requirements.
* Leading DevSecOps best practice efforts across multiple teams. 
* Managed CI/CD pipelines using Gitlab CI and Github Actions for efficient deployment, including build, lint, unit, integration, and system tests, semantic versioning, as well as dependency scanning.
* Contributed to diverse projects and leveraged AWS technologies to deliver highly scalable, secure, efficient, and mission critical solutions for clients.
* Assessment of applications on software design and software development cycle best practices.
* Supporting sales efforts by providing designs and effort estimate
* Recruitment efforts
profile_positions.title: Mission Critical Engineer - AWS Expert, Solution Architect, Leader

profile_positions.description:
* Worked as a freelance Mission Critical Engineer at Schuberg Philis, specializing in AWS and leading serverless applications development.
* Designed and implemented an AWS solution in the energy sector, focusing on orchestrating various calculations using serverless AWS services such as StepFunctions, Fargate, Lambda, Glue, Athena, and autoscaled EC2s. Led and consulted a team of 5 consisting of data scientists and developers. 
* Demonstrated a strong expertise of serverless architecture principles and effectively utilized AWS services to achieve efficiency, scalability, and cost-effectiveness solutions.
* Collaborated closely with clients to understand their specific requirements and deliver tailored AWS solutions that met their needs.
* Lead DevOps activities by guiding CI/CD pipeline implementation, recommending best practices, and advising on designs & implementations.
profile_positions.title: Mission Critical Engineer (Freelance at Schuberg Philis)

profile_positions.description:
* Leading a team in the development of a smart solution for optimizing traffic flows through the utilization of vehicle detections and forecasting techniques to efficiently control traffic lights.
* Successfully delivered a real-time visualization system for signal states on traffic lights as a client-rich application using Angular 6, leveraging the d3 library to provide real-time visualization of traffic lights.
* Implemented a Cassandra-backed events store to store relevant data for signal states.
* Designed and configured an AWS environment specifically tailored for simulation purposes to migrate this workload from on-premise to AWS.  Leveraged the AWS environment to conduct simulations and evaluate the performance of the traffic flow optimization solution. Ensured seamless integration between the simulation environment and the real-time visualization system.
* Led the technical aspects of the project, ensuring successful implementation and performance of the solution.
profile_positions.title: Java Lead Developer

profile_positions.description:
* Led the development of a Garcia Jeans webshop with a new design built upon an existing Hybris solution.
* Led a B2B solution project for Hanos, starting from scratch and designed a custom-made solution for customer-specific pricing and product search using AWS technologies ElastiCache, Lambda, Gateway API, and a custom Solr plugin.
* Managed a migration project from Hybris 4.x to 6.x, including some redesign aspects.
* Led a PIM project for Raiffeisen Ware Austria, implementing a microservices architecture with Spring Cloud, ElasticSearch, Docker Swarm, and an Angular 2 frontend for managing locations, employees, business areas, and related entities.
* Oversaw the design and development of a unified API layer and a self-developed OAuth2 security layer for Hema, along with ElasticSearch indexes for visualization (Kibana) and interfaces related to invoices, stocks, and stores. The index had a significant scale, with hundreds of millions of documents. We adopted AWS SAM as IaC and designed the solution with AWS serverless stack (Lambda, SQS, SNS, API Gateway, SSM, DynamoDB).
* Early adopter of AWS Lambda and serverless AWS tech stack. 
* Leading by example with DevOps best practices. 
* Hiring, coaching and leading development teams.
profile_positions.title: Technical Team Leader

company.name: The European Library (Employment via Europeana Foundation)

profile_positions.company: The European Library (Employment via Europeana Foundation)
profile_positions.description:
* Served as Technical and Operations Manager, responsible for managing technical development and operational work with a team of 7. 
* Led and managed the technical team, ensuring their effective performance and collaboration.
* Designed technical solutions for The European Library and ensured their timely delivery of various European Union projects.
* Held leading roles on two key European Union projects: Europeana Cloud (private cloud for a shared infrastructure for three major aggregators using open source technologies like Cassandra, OpenStack Swift, Kafka, Storm, Logstash, Ganglia, and SolrCloud) and Europeana Newspapers (OCR fulltext of historical newspapers).
* Held responsibility for the maintenance, upkeep, and enhancement of The European Library portal (www.theeuropeanlibrary.org) and the Unified Ingestion Manager framework.
profile_positions.title: Technical and Operations Manager

company.name: The European Library (Employment via Koninklijke Bibliotheek)

profile_positions.company: The European Library (Employment via Koninklijke Bibliotheek)
profile_positions.description:
* Led the development of a newly-designed end-user portal and an internal orchestration framework called Unified Ingestion Manager (UIM) to aggregate data from hundreds of libraries in a team of 5. 
* Oversaw the implementation of an orchestration framework built in an OSGi environment and a custom non-SQL data store using SOLR and MongoDB that can scale to 100+ millions of records. 
* Designed and built multiple OSGi plugins for loading, normalization, enrichment, harmonization, and indexing of bibliographic records.
* Developed a GWT-based administration frontend to manage the workflows for processing bibliographic data.
* Designed the web portal to showcase the bibliographic records and provided access through an open search API built on Wicket. Implemented innovative features such as statistics-based query suggestion, normalization of persons, organizations, places, and topics using open data sets like VIAF, geonames, and MACS. Employed clustering techniques to identify and improve searchability of duplicate records.
* Delivered high-quality software by maintaining best practices by using CI/CD pipelines, unit, integration and system testing, static code analysis and code reviews.
* Coaching of junior staff.
profile_positions.title: Lead Developer

profile_positions.description:
* Developed various systems using techniques in machine learning, knowledge discovery, information retrieval, and knowledge visualization.
* Led the development of frameworks from design to release phase, taking on the role of lead developer.
* Led the development of a stand-alone sub-module for machine learning algorithms within an all-embracing client/server solution based on a generic knowledge discovery framework Knowminer for M2N.
* Played a key role in developing a database solution for Bertelsmann, managing and retrieving encyclopedia articles.
* Improved a customized information retrieval solution related to the "Internet of Things" concept for Magna Graz Development, involving RFID chip-based human tracking and data visualization.
* Authored and co-authored multiple papers for SIGIR and WWW industry conferences during my time at the Know-Centre.
profile_positions.title: Software Developer / Researcher

profile_positions.description:

* Ensured diligent testing and quality assurance to deliver a reliable and robust system.
